Timing and mechanisms of immune evasion in colorectal cancers

No authors listed. Nat Genet. 2025.

No abstract available

PubMed Disclaimer

References

    1. Galassi, C., Chan, T. A., Vitale, I. & Galluzzi, L. The hallmarks of cancer immune evasion. Cancer Cell 11, 1825–1863 (2024). This review summarizes immune evasion pathways and their therapeutic relevance. - DOI
    1. Cornish, A. J. et al. The genomic landscape of 2,023 colorectal cancers. Nature 633, 127–136 (2024). This paper describes genetic immunological alterations in 2,023 CRCs. - DOI - PubMed - PMC
    1. Heide, T. et al. The co-evolution of the genome and epigenome in colorectal cancer. Nature 611, 733–743 (2022). This paper presents the multi-omic EPICC dataset and highlights the importance of chromatin alterations in cancer development. - DOI - PubMed - PMC
    1. Sottoriva, A. et al. A Big Bang model of human colorectal tumor growth. Nat. Genet. 47, 209–216 (2015). This paper presents the ‘Big Bang’ model of how CRCs develop. - DOI - PubMed - PMC
